On 10 August 2011, a German court granted a preliminary injuction pending a full hearing prohibiting Galaxy Tab 10.1 sales in the European Union (except in the Netherlands, where a second action is running).<ref>{{cite news|last=Tsukayama|first=Hayley|title=Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 imports banned in most of Europe|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/faster-forward/post/samsung-galaxy-tab-101-imports-banned-in-most-of-europe/2011/08/10/gIQAmnVr6I_blog.html|accessdate=11 August 2011|newspaper=The Washington Post|date=10 August 2011}}</ref> Although Samsung is accused of violating 10 separate patents Apple holds on transmission of data and on wireless communications technology,<ref name=hindu-aug11>Halliday, Josh (11 August 2011). [http://www.thehindu.com/sci-tech/article2347408.ece "Patent court blocks sale of Samsung Galaxy Tab in EU"]. ''[[The Hindu]]''.</ref><ref>Apple's complaint, written by law firm Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer (German language), [http://www.scribd.com/doc/61993811/10-08-04-Apple-Motion-for-EU-Wide-Prel-Inj-Galaxy-Tab-10-1], accessed 10 August 2011</ref><ref>Case number 14c O 194/11 (according to dpa journalist Christoph Dernbach), [https://twitter.com/#!/CDernbach/status/100961863482867712], accessed 10 August 2011</ref><ref>Community design no. 000181607-0001, [http://www.onemorething.nl/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/61944044-Community-Design-000181607-0001.pdf], accessed 10 August 2011</ref><ref>Intellectual property activist Florian Mueller: Why Samsung was not put on notice before the European Galaxy Tab 10.1 injunction was ordered, [http://fosspatents.blogspot.com/2011/08/why-samsung-was-not-put-on-notice.html], accessed 10 August 2011</ref><ref>Samsung Galaxay Tab 10.1 Banned in Europe, [http://www.techteria.com/news/samsung-galaxy-tab-10-1-banned-europe-146/], accessed 10 August 2011</ref><ref name=Tab> Peter Clarke, EE Times. "[http://eetimes.com/electronics-news/4218656/Apple-Samsung-Galaxy-tablet-banned-Europe Samsung Galaxy tablet is banned in Europe]." 10 August 2011. Retrieved 10 August 2011. </ref> the injunction was granted on the basis of an alleged infringement of one of Apple's [[community design|registered community designs]] relating to the iPad 2.<ref name=Tab/> Press sources reported that customs officials across the European Union have seized inbound shipments of the product after the ruling, effectively locking it out of the key European market,<ref name=hindu-aug11/> and its listing was removed by online retailer [[Amazon.com|Amazon.co.uk]].<ref>{{cite news | last = Tsukayama | first = Hayley | title = Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 imports banned in most of Europe | url = http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/faster-forward/post/samsung-galaxy-tab-101-imports-banned-in-most-of-europe/2011/08/10/gIQAmnVr6I_blog.html |work=The Washington Post | date = 10 August 2011 | accessdate =11 August 2011}}</ref> Samsung stated it did not receive a notice of Apple's request to stop sales of its tablet.<ref>{{cite news | last1 = Decker | first1 = Susan | last2 = Kjetland | first2 = Ragnhild | title = Apple Wins Order Against Samsung Galaxy Tablet in EU | url = http://washpost.bloomberg.com/Story?docId=1376-LPOBFO0UQVI901-15TC6KL1SI8S98SF70C86O26UF |work=The Washington Post | agency=[[Bloomberg L.P.]] | date = 9 August 2011 | accessdate =11 August 2011}}</ref> It has retaliated against Apple's move with counterclaims at home in South Korea and abroad in Japan, the U.S., and Germany.<ref name=hindu-aug11/>
On 10 August 2011, a German court granted a preliminary injuction pending a full hearing prohibiting Galaxy Tab 10.1 sales in the European Union (except in the Netherlands, where a second action is running).<ref>{{cite news|last=Tsukayama|first=Hayley|title=Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 imports banned in most of Europe|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/faster-forward/post/samsung-galaxy-tab-101-imports-banned-in-most-of-europe/2011/08/10/gIQAmnVr6I_blog.html|accessdate=11 August 2011|newspaper=The Washington Post|date=10 August 2011}}</ref> Although Samsung is accused of violating 10 separate patents Apple holds on transmission of data and on wireless communications technology,<ref name=hindu-aug11>Halliday, Josh (11 August 2011). [http://www.thehindu.com/sci-tech/article2347408.ece "Patent court blocks sale of Samsung Galaxy Tab in EU"]. ''[[The Hindu]]''.</ref><ref>Apple's complaint, written by law firm Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer (German language), [http://www.scribd.com/doc/61993811/10-08-04-Apple-Motion-for-EU-Wide-Prel-Inj-Galaxy-Tab-10-1], accessed 10 August 2011</ref><ref>Case number 14c O 194/11 (according to dpa journalist Christoph Dernbach), [https://twitter.com/#!/CDernbach/status/100961863482867712], accessed 10 August 2011</ref><ref>Community design no. 000181607-0001, [http://www.onemorething.nl/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/61944044-Community-Design-000181607-0001.pdf], accessed 10 August 2011</ref><ref>Intellectual property activist Florian Mueller: Why Samsung was not put on notice before the European Galaxy Tab 10.1 injunction was ordered, [http://fosspatents.blogspot.com/2011/08/why-samsung-was-not-put-on-notice.html], accessed 10 August 2011</ref><ref>Samsung Galaxay Tab 10.1 Banned in Europe, [http://www.techteria.com/news/samsung-galaxy-tab-10-1-banned-europe-146/], accessed 10 August 2011</ref><ref name=Tab> Peter Clarke, EE Times. "[http://eetimes.com/electronics-news/4218656/Apple-Samsung-Galaxy-tablet-banned-Europe Samsung Galaxy tablet is banned in Europe]." 10 August 2011. Retrieved 10 August 2011. </ref> the injunction was granted on the basis of an alleged infringement of one of Apple's [[community design|registered community designs]] relating to the iPad 2.<ref name=Tab/> Press sources reported that customs officials across the European Union have seized inbound shipments of the product after the ruling, effectively locking it out of the key European market,<ref name=hindu-aug11/> and its listing was removed by online retailer [[Amazon.com|Amazon.co.uk]].<ref>{{cite news | last = Tsukayama | first = Hayley | title = Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 imports banned in most of Europe | url = http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/faster-forward/post/samsung-galaxy-tab-101-imports-banned-in-most-of-europe/2011/08/10/gIQAmnVr6I_blog.html |work=The Washington Post | date = 10 August 2011 | accessdate =11 August 2011}}</ref> Samsung stated it did not receive a notice of Apple's request to stop sales of its tablet.<ref>{{cite news | last1 = Decker | first1 = Susan | last2 = Kjetland | first2 = Ragnhild | title = Apple Wins Order Against Samsung Galaxy Tablet in EU | url = http://washpost.bloomberg.com/Story?docId=1376-LPOBFO0UQVI901-15TC6KL1SI8S98SF70C86O26UF |work=The Washington Post | agency=[[Bloomberg L.P.]] | date = 9 August 2011 | accessdate =11 August 2011}}</ref> It has retaliated against Apple's move with counterclaims at home in South Korea and abroad in Japan, the U.S., and Germany.<ref name=hindu-aug11/>
â
The Dutch magazine Webwereld reported an investigation into evidence contrasting the two devices submitted to the German court by Apple, in which the Galaxy Tab pictured does not accurately reflect the product. An example from the court document shows the Samsung device with aspect dimensions much closer to Apple's device, and the Samsung logo appears to have been digitally removed.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://webwereld.nl/nieuws/107599/apple-levert-onjuist-bewijs-in-zaak-tegen-samsung.html |title=Apple levert onjuist bewijs in zaak tegen Samsung |date=15 August 2011 |accessdate=15 August 2011 |language=Dutch}}</ref>
+
The Dutch magazine Webwereld reported an investigation into evidence contrasting the two devices submitted to the German court by Apple, in which the Galaxy Tab pictured does not accurately reflect the product. An example from the court document shows the Samsung device with aspect dimensions much closer to Apple's device, and the Samsung logo appears to have been digitally removed.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://webwereld.nl/nieuws/107599/apple-levert-onjuist-bewijs-in-zaak-tegen-samsung.html |title=Apple levert onjuist bewijs in zaak tegen Samsung |date=15 August 2011 |accessdate=15 August 2011 |language=Dutch}}</ref><ref>http://www.osnews.com/story/25065/Apple_Tampered_with_Evidence_in_German_Apple_v_Samsung_Case</ref>
